lines.text:
[seeing a dead person in a bed surrounded by people eating]
Look!
It's nothing. A man died. It's an old custom. His friends are throwing a party for him.

[to one of the mourners with a plate of food]
Cumbari. How'd he die?

[matter-of-factly]
Two bullets.

[with urgency to the driver]
Right. Let's go!
The lies of a woman when softened by grace and courtesy are always welcome.
Why do you say Sicily's uncivilized? It's very civilized and we have to live up to that.
No, we have to act like men - and that snake was right - you are a woman!
No, Papa! Please don't say that!

[contemptuously]
Fuck off!
Your mother hasn't said a word to me since we arrived. She stares at me as if I was some kind of exotic animal.

[passing a street vendor]
Now, a nice cap for the gentleman. What color do you want... black or checked?
Black.
Want to try it on?
[Nino looks at himself in a mirror.]
Now you're really one of us.
Thinking fully dressed or half naked is still thinking.
The only way to go back is to go forward. It's stupid to be scared.

[looking ahead on the ferry]
Look over there!
[enthusiastically]
Sicily! Island of the sun and Cyclops! The inspiration to all the poets!
[noticing his wife's lack of enthusiasm]
What's the matter, Marta?

[wistfully]
Nothing. I was just watching Italy fade away.
I may live in Milan, but I'm still Sicilian.
Remember when I said there were four hares. I bagged two of them. But if I'd had a Winch... a Winchester, I'd have bagged them all.

[Having arrived at his family home in Sicily, greeting his various relatives]
Dear Catella! Have you cooked me spaghetti with sardines?

[At lunch table, asking about Rosalia's engagement]
To whom?
Domenico Licasi... for more than two years.
I didn't know.
It's not official.
What does he do?
He sits.

[Unfamiliar with the term "sit"]
Office worker?
Unemployed. That's how we put it here.
If they marry, I'll have another mouth to feed.

[In protest]
Domenico wouldn't accept! He's a worker!... but unlucky.
[At the lunch table, asking about old acquaintances]
He left.
And Ciccio?
Emigrated.
And Alfio?

[Answers in local dialect]
"in jail"
In jail?
Crime of honor.
And Filo?

[Everybody at table suddenly becomes uncomfortably silent]
Dead?
Went astray

[Turning to Uncle Turi]
What's that mean?
Betrayed his friends.
Goes around on a motorbike, agitating among the farm laborers.
And Tota? And Nicola? And Jano?
All sitting. You were lucky, even though you deserved it. Don't forget that.
I won't... And after lunch, I'm going to see Don Vincenzo. I've a favor to do for an important businessman - an American from Calamo.

[Nino's wife has succeeded in removing noticeable mustache hair from Rosalia's upper lip]
Rosalia, come. Let me look at you! You're like porcelain. Smooth. White. Take my advice. Marry before your mustache grows again!

[Don Vincenzo has helped settle a land purchase dispute for Nino's father. Nino is overwhelmed with gratitude]
Blessed Don Vincenzo, may you live a thousand years in our gratitude!
It's a small thing. We should all help each other.
If you need me one day, just say the word. Your word is my command.
Don Vincenzo, what is it I'm doing?
What are you doing? Something very important. But if you wish... you can say no. Do you say no?
Do I say no?... I say yes.
